Organs/Tissues: Various solid tumors (e.g. lung, colorectal, melanoma, breast, etc.)
Physiological/Pathological: Pathological (human tumor tissue) with preserved immune/stromal context
Cell Source: Fresh patient tumor specimens → micro-fragments (tumor + stroma + immune cells)
Multiple Cell Types: Yes (tumor cells, fibroblasts, endothelial, immune infiltrates)
Stromal Cells: Yes, cancer-associated fibroblasts, etc., from the original tumor
Circulating Immune: No intrinsic circulation, but immune cells can be added externally (e.g. PBMCs, CAR-T)
Extracellular Matrix: Yes (native tumor ECM within each fragment)
Notable Features: Preserves patient-specific TME, short-term ex vivo culture, high-content imaging, immune/tumor interactions
Max Culture Duration: ~3–5 days typical (up to ~1 week) for drug assays
model_availability: Service only (CRO model using in-house tumoroids)
